Captain America, also known as Steve Rogers, challenges societal expectations of masculinity in several ways in the Marvel Cinematic Universe. 

Firstly, Steve Rogers is not portrayed as the typical hyper-masculine superhero. He is physically strong and capable, but he is also gentle and compassionate, which are often seen as feminine traits. He is not afraid to show emotion, and he values teamwork and honor over individualism and aggression.

Secondly, Steve Rogers rejects toxic masculinity and traditional gender roles. He is respectful towards women and does not objectify them or treat them as inferior. He also challenges the belief that physical strength is the most important aspect of masculinity, instead emphasizing the importance of character and morality.

Thirdly, Steve Rogers challenges male stereotypes by being willing to sacrifice himself for the greater good. He puts his own life on the line to protect others and to fight for justice, rather than pursuing personal glory or satisfaction.

Overall, the character of Captain America challenges societal expectations of masculinity by promoting a more balanced and inclusive view of what it means to be a hero and a man.
